data.meanings: Slit, cut, divide lengthwise, split, enlarge or make wideEmbarking upon the sea or a great river (vast expanse of water)Growing in anything (wealth, possessions, knowledge etc)A vast expanse of water (Ocean, sea, huge river)A fleet swift horse called because of its speed like the rolling of the waves in the seaA generous man who is ample in his generosityWide tract of land, land belonging to or inhabited by peopleAny town, village or city that has a running river or a body of waterLow or depressed landA large meadow or gardenA place where water stagnatesOf, relating to, or belonging to the ocean, sea or any vast body of waterSeaman, sailorVehemence of heat (corresponding to the month of July, Syrian)The moon"Bahira" (a camel dedicated to idols, 5:103)?
data.sentence: The word الْبَحْرَ comes from the root ب ح ر and is associated with the meanings: Slit, cut, divide lengthwise, split, enlarge or make wideEmbarking upon the sea or a great river (vast expanse of water)Growing in anything (wealth, possessions, knowledge etc)A vast expanse of water (Ocean, sea, huge river)A fleet swift horse called because of its speed like the rolling of the waves in the seaA generous man who is ample in his generosityWide tract of land, land belonging to or inhabited by peopleAny town, village or city that has a running river or a body of waterLow or depressed landA large meadow or gardenA place where water stagnatesOf, relating to, or belonging to the ocean, sea or any vast body of waterSeaman, sailorVehemence of heat (corresponding to the month of July, Syrian)The moon"Bahira" (a camel dedicated to idols, 5:103)?

data.meanings: sank, drowned, went downwards and disappeared, became without need, drew the bow to the full (with vehement fulling), outstripped, engrossed, a man overwhelmed by trials, single draught, ornamented, obligatory
data.sentence: The word مُغْرَقُونَ comes from the root غ ر ق and is associated with the meanings: sank, drowned, went downwards and disappeared, became without need, drew the bow to the full (with vehement fulling), outstripped, engrossed, a man overwhelmed by trials, single draught, ornamented, obligatory

data.meanings: Collect or assemble [armies, military forces], prepare an army, Jundun [collected body of men prepared for war; auxiliaries].
data.sentence: The word جُنْدٌ comes from the root ج ن د and is associated with the meanings: Collect or assemble [armies, military forces], prepare an army, Jundun [collected body of men prepared for war; auxiliaries].

data.meanings: To leave off, leave alone, abandon/desert/relinquish/quit, forsake, give up anything, neglect, omit, bequeath anything to anyone.
data.sentence: The word وَاتْرُكِ comes from the root ت ر ك and is associated with the meanings: To leave off, leave alone, abandon/desert/relinquish/quit, forsake, give up anything, neglect, omit, bequeath anything to anyone.

data.meanings: to walk gently, fall calmly (sea), act gently, be depressed, motionless, go slowly, part (the legs and make an opening between them). rahw - calm/quiet/motionless, depressed place, broad place, elevated ground, dry tract of land.
data.sentence: The word رَهْوًا comes from the root ر ه و and is associated with the meanings: to walk gently, fall calmly (sea), act gently, be depressed, motionless, go slowly, part (the legs and make an opening between them). rahw - calm/quiet/motionless, depressed place, broad place, elevated ground, dry tract of land.
